clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Smartphone Push Notifications on Brain Power Score
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing the Effect of Smartphone Push Notifications on Overall Score, Accuracy and Reaction Time of Brain Power Score

brief_summary.textblock: This study will examine how Brain Power Score, an objective measure of brain function, is affected by the presence of smartphone push notifications.

detailed_description.textblock:
Smartphones are a common device integrated into the lives of many individuals around the world. Researchers have previously found a relationship between mobile phone use and changes in brain activity, reaction times and sleep patterns.
Brain Power is a consumer-grade application using a proprietary combination of neurological (EEG) and behavioral (reaction time and accuracy) data to create a comprehensive score out of 1000 which allows users to have an objective evaluation of their brain performance.
This study will examine how Brain Power Score is affected by the presence of smartphone push notifications.

primary_outcome.description: Brain Power Score combines neurological (EEG) and behavioral (reaction time and accuracy) data to create a comprehensive score out of 1000.

secondary_outcome.description: Time to respond to the stimulus (milliseconds)

arm_group.description: Push notification number (0, 1, 3, 5) will be counter balanced within-subjects.

intervention.description: The purpose of this study is to assess how smartphone push notifications can impact the overall score, accuracy and reaction time of participants using the Brain Power Score application (app). Push notification quantity will be varied and counter-balanced.
